item.ptxt: Use the same procedure for the RH and LH sides.
The procedure listed below is for the LH side.

atten3.ptxt: After turning the ignition switch off, waiting time may be required before disconnecting the cable from the battery terminal. Therefore, make sure to read the disconnecting the cable from the battery terminal notice before proceeding with work (See page ).

s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT CABLE FROM NEGATIVE BATTERY TERMINAL (w/ Power Window)

atten3.ptxt: When disconnecting the cable, some systems need to be initialized after the cable is reconnected (See page ).

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR POWER WINDOW REGULATOR SWITCH ASSEMBLY WITH REAR DOOR ARMREST BASE PANEL (w/ Power Window)

s2.ptxt: Remove the screw.
Detach the 2 clips and 8 claws.
Disconnect the connector and remove the rear power window regulator switch assembly with rear door armrest base panel.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR UPPER ARMREST BASE PANEL LH (w/o Power Window)

s2.ptxt: Remove the screw.
Detach the 2 clips and 8 claws and remove the rear door upper armrest base panel.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR WINDOW REGULATOR HANDLE ASSEMBLY (w/o Power Window)

s2.ptxt: Insert a clip remover between the plate and rear door trim board.

atten4.ptxt: Tape the clip remover tip before use.

s2.ptxt: Turn the handle clockwise to remove the snap ring, rear door window regulator handle and plate.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR TRIM BOARD SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the screw.
Detach the 10 clips and remove the rear door trim board.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR INSIDE HANDLE SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Detach the claw and 2 guides as indicated by the arrows in the order shown in the illustration.
Disconnect the rear door inside locking cable and rear door lock remote control cable and remove the rear door inside handle.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR NO. 2 TRIM BRACKET

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 screws and rear door No. 2 trim bracket.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR SERVICE HOLE COVER LH

s2.ptxt: Pull out the wire harness from the rear door service hole cover.
Pull out the rear door inside locking cable and rear door lock remote control cable from the rear door service hole cover, and then remove the rear door service hole cover.

atten4.ptxt: Remove any remaining butyl tape from the rear door panel.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR WINDOW DIVISION BAR SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: w/ Power Window:

s3.ptxt: Temporarily install the rear power window regulator switch assembly with rear door armrest base panel.
Connect the cable to the negative (-) battery terminal.
Move the rear door glass so that the rear door glass channel can be seen.
Disconnect the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal.

atten3.ptxt: When disconnecting the cable, some systems need to be initialized after the cable is reconnected (See page ).

s3.ptxt: Remove the rear power window regulator switch assembly with rear door armrest base panel.

s2.ptxt: w/o Power Window:

s3.ptxt: Temporarily install the rear door window regulator handle.
Move the rear door glass sub-assembly so that the rear door glass bolts can be seen.
Remove the rear door window regulator handle.

s2.ptxt: Partially remove the rear door glass run as shown in the illustration.
Loosen the temporary bolt.

atten3.ptxt: Do not remove the temporary bolt. If the temporary bolt is removed, the rear door window division bar may fall and become damaged.

s2.ptxt: Remove the screw and bolt.
Remove the rear door window division bar together with the rear door glass run as shown in the illustration.
Remove the rear door window division bar from the rear door glass run.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR GLASS RUN LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the front side of the rear door glass run.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR QUARTER WINDOW GLASS LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the rear door quarter window glass.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR GLASS SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the rear door glass from the rear door window regulator assembly as shown in the illustration.

atten3.ptxt: Do not damage the door glass.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DOOR BELT MOULDING ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Put protective tape around the rear door belt moulding.
Detach the 5 claws and remove the rear door belt moulding.
